intro: Phyllactis mapirensis, commonly known as the Mapire thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive tubular shape. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic, a common trait within its family.
